item.title: Migrants, refugees make up worker shortfall in Ararat
item.description: Ararat, like most regional towns, has an ageing population and a drift of young people to the cities. But a migrant resettlement program is reinvigorating the town.

item.title: Sydney pro-Palestinian protest organisers deny police fears of 'perilous situation' on harbour bridge
item.description: A safe end to the pro-Palestinian protest has not allayed concerns about separate mass demonstrations across the world-famous landmark, senior NSW Police say.

item.title: David Cartledge pleads guilty to arson causing death over Red Cliffs fire
item.description: David Cartledge has admitted to lighting the fire that killed his housemate in 2023.

item.title: NSW government kills debate on protesters paying for police presence after exceeding cap
item.description: A renewed push to limit activists to staging three protests a year with taxpayer-funded crowd control has been shut down by the NSW government.

item.title: Nepal's prime minister resigns after worst protests in decades amid claims of corruption
item.description: The resignation came after protesters set fire to homes of some of the country's top political leaders in opposition to a social media ban that was lifted a day after deadly anti-government protests.

item.title: Trump says he's 'not a dictator' but he could be an authoritarian
item.description: Trump is not an American monarch. Nor is he an American dictator. Nonetheless, he is displaying blatant signs of being an American authoritarian.

item.title: Australia’s first publicly-funded eating disorder treatment centre opens
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: ASIO chief Mike Burgess gives Australia's national security agency a public face
item.description: If the intelligence community had its Logies, ASIO chief Mike Burgess would be chasing gold this week.

item.title: 'Life couldn't be normal again': What it's like to go straight from school to the NRL
item.description: Heamasi Makasini will become one of select group of players to debut in the NRL while still at high school, but what's it actually like when a boyhood rugby league fantasy comes to life?

item.title: New NDIS price cap for 'life-changing' music and art therapy revealed after review
item.description: Music and art therapists will be able to bill NDIS participants at the same rate as counsellors after a review found the therapies could be effective in the right circumstances.

item.title: Gippslanders ready to move on after Erin Patterson's mushroom murder trial sentencing
item.description: With Erin Patterson's 33-year sentence handed down, the Gippsland community hopes to get back to normal.

item.title: Taiwan votes in major recall election closely watched by China
item.description: Voters in Taiwan are casting ballots on whether to recall one-fifth of the island's parliament, all from the major opposition party, in a move supporters hope will send a message to China.

item.title: Recorded sexual assault victim-survivors surpass 40,000 nationwide, ABS data reveals
item.description: The sexual assault victimisation rate is now the highest it has been since the ABS began releasing data in 1993.

item.title: Zelenskyy says you can't hold an election during a war. Is this true?
item.description: Ukraine hasn't held a presidential election since 2019. International law experts say it's "ultimately not safe" until a peace agreement is reached with Russia.

item.title: NATO announces operation 'Eastern Sentry' in response to Russian drone incursion in Poland
item.description: NATO announces plans to beef up the defence of Europe's eastern flank two days after Poland shot down Russian drones that had violated its airspace.

item.title: Police used 'excessive' force on Aboriginal man in wheelchair, court finds
item.description: Body-worn video footage played to the Darwin Local Court captures a loud thud as an Aboriginal man with a disability is dropped into a police wagon, drawing an audible gasp from another officer.

item.title: First female boundary umpires in AFL reflect on historic evening
item.description: Over the weekend, Melissa Sambrooks, Kaitlin Barr and Greta Miller became the first ever female AFL boundary umpires.

item.title: Basil Zempilas seeks to repair damage from Jacinta Nampijinpa Price remarks on Indian migrants
item.description: Basil Zempilas writes to the Indian Society of WA in a bid to smooth over damage caused by comments from federal colleague Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, as she prepares to speak at an event at one of the society's venues.

item.title: Only Melbourne Vixens' best will challenge West Coast Fever in Super Netball grand final, says Simone McKinnis
item.description: West Coast will start the Super Netball grand final as favourites but the Melbourne Vixens are battle-hardened after scrapping through to the title match.

item.title: Trump receives mixed reaction of boos, cheers at US Open men's final
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What did Bailey Smith say? Geelong Cats star abuses News Corp photographer at training
item.description: A veteran Geelong Advertiser photographer says she has never had a player confront her for taking a photograph at training, aside from two incidents involving Cats superstar Bailey Smith.

item.title: US demands Australia lifts defence spending by $40b a year 'as soon as possible'
item.description: The United States wants Australia to lift spending on defence to about $100 billion a year, with its Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth warning of a "real and potentially imminent" threat from China.

item.title: Fears eating disorders could be triggered by food insecurity
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nepalese anti-government protests continue over corruption and lack of economic opportunity
item.description: Anti-government protests erupt into deadly violence, with Nepalese youth venting their frustration over a political system they accuse of corruption.

item.title: Gout Gout wins under-23 200m race at Diamond League
item.description: Seventeen-year-old Gout Gout wins the under-23 200m race at the Diamond League event in Monaco, where Jess Hull and Peter Bol beat national records.

item.title: Hobart woman joins Global Sumud Flotilla mission for Gaza
item.description: A Tasmanian woman says she is prepared to be labelled as "stupid, naive, reckless" for her decision to join what organisers have described as a "civilian maritime mission organised to break Israel's illegal siege on Gaza".

item.title: Donald Trump's health chief, RFK Jr, is dividing Republicans on vaccines
item.description: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr's anti-vaccination agenda is gaining ground, but resistance is coming from all sides.

item.title: Men's shed volunteers craft simple gifts to make young hearts skip with joy
item.description: Retired farmer John's foray into woodworking has led to mateship, connections with kids in need around the world — and quite a few skipping rope handles.

item.title: Understanding the literal bin fires in Europe's 'magical mystery summer' of inaction
item.description: Moscow's drone incursion into Polish airspace this week may have just laid bare how fruitless Europe's summer of talkfests has been.

item.title: Queensland's Papua New Guinean community celebrates 50 years of independence
item.description: Thousands of people from Queensland's Papua New Guinean community celebrate half a century of the country's independence with traditional music, dancing, art, and food.

item.title: Tobruk Fig Tree cutting planted in Port Lincoln to honour Eyre Peninsula's Rats
item.description: Many of the Rats of Tobruk hailed from the Eyre Peninsula and, after years of work, their legacy has been commemorated by a very special tree taking root.

item.title: Air strikes kill at least 32 in Gaza City as Israel ramps up its offensive
item.description: Israel in recent days has intensified strikes across Gaza City, destroying multiple high-rise buildings and accusing Hamas of putting surveillance equipment in them.

item.title: Wallabies fall to 28-26 defeat against Argentina in The Rugby Championship in Sydney
item.description: The Wallabies have fallen just short of a magical comeback against Argentina, losing 28-26 in a thrilling Rugby Championship Test in Sydney.

item.title: Tiwi Islanders eager to have their say as remote voting for the federal election begins
item.description: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

item.title: AFLW wrap: Collingwood ends Sydney's unbeaten run, Carlton thumps Gold Coast, the Power beats the Demons
item.description: Collingwood, wooden spooners last season, keep Sydney goalless for more than three quarters at home on Saturday for an upset win, as Port Adelaide beat another unbeaten side in Melbourne.

item.title: Limestone Coast is a food bowl and forestry powerhouse, but its water supply is under threat
item.description: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: The simple system I use for composting
item.description: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

item.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
item.description: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

item.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
item.description: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

item.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
item.description: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

item.title: Murdochs resolve succession saga but family's hold on empire is vulnerable
item.description: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

item.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
item.description: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

item.title: Australian-funded PALM scheme liaison workers say they went months without pay
item.description: Pacific Islanders supporting PALM workers say they have had to go to great lengths — including flying to their home countries — to chase money owed to them.

item.title: Elderly Porepunkah woman left without in-home care as Freeman manhunt continues
item.description: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

item.title: 'Bubble curtain' ready to protect cuttlefish as algal bloom persists in SA
item.description: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

item.title: ASX higher on US rate cut expectations, but markets underestimating inflation risk — as it happened
item.description: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Westpac's economics team, led by former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis, say they think markets are underpricing the risk of a renewed inflation breakout in the US.

item.title: From Formula One to creating the 'world's best' croissant, how baking saved Lune founder Kate Reid's life
item.description: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

item.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
item.description: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

item.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
item.description: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

item.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
item.description: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
item.description: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

item.title: 'Low levels of satisfaction' with healthcare in Canberra for endometriosis, menopause, identified in Women's Health Matters survey
item.description: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

item.title: In their Melbourne Fringe Show, First Trimester, performer Krishna Istha is seeking a sperm donor
item.description: Krishna Istha has made a habit of turning to performance to solve a problem. So when they needed help to find a sperm donor, the solution was obvious.

item.title: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
item.description: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

item.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
item.description: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

item.title: WA Health issues measles warning as two more cases linked to Bali travel
item.description: West Australians planning to visit South-East Asia are being urged to get vaccinated against measles, with two more cases linked with travel to Bali.

item.title: Australia and Fiji to press ahead with security treaty talks as Vanuatu deal goes unsigned
item.description: The government is still racing to expand ties with Pacific nations — particularly the current governments in Fiji and Papua New Guinea — despite a diplomatic setback with Vanuatu.

item.title: Australia and Papua New Guinea to 'totally integrate' military in defence treaty, minister says
item.description: Australia is set to "totally integrate" its military with Papua New Guinea's forces, PNG's defence minister has said, as the two countries prepare to sign a landmark treaty.

item.title: Suns coach Damien Hardwick praised ahead of historic finals clash against Lions
item.description: Brisbane Lions great Alastair Lynch hails the impact of Damien Hardwick at the Gold Coast Suns as they look to continue their run in the finals.

item.title: Albanese government pours $12 billion into expanding AUKUS defence facility near Perth
item.description: The Albanese government will spend $12 billion on building a submarine and naval shipbuilding facility south of Perth under AUKUS, as doubts linger over the agreement's future.

item.title: Who is Tyler Robinson, the accused killer of Charlie Kirk?
item.description: After his father encouraged Tyler Robinson to turn himself in, people close to the 22-year-old provided investigators with crucial insights.

item.title: Who is Larry Ellison and how did he overtake Elon Musk to briefly become the richest person in the world?
item.description: The switch in the ranking comes after a blockbuster earnings report from Oracle, powered by multi-billion-dollar orders from customers as the AI race heats up.

item.title: Children missing out on early intervention for language delays due to shortage of speech pathologists
item.description: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.

item.title: Former minister Greg Hunt works for Brethren company whose owners made millions on COVID contracts
item.description: The Sydney-based church has been described by former members and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese as a "cult".

item.title: Adrianne Lenker on Big Thief's evolution and the making of Double Infinity
item.description: At the peak of their success, Big Thief faced a major emotional rupture that reshaped the group from the inside out. Now, they've returned with their sixth album, shaped by deep creative trust and a renewed commitment to collaboration.

item.title: Israel's air strike campaign levelling Gaza City's remaining buildings
item.description: Israel has dramatically ramped up its attacks in Gaza City in the past week with a targeted campaign to strike its high-rises. Hundreds of structures have been destroyed, forcing thousands of already displaced Palestinians to flee.

item.title: Migrants from Dubai, Philippines breathe new life into Edenhope
item.description: When Nausheen Hashmi moved to a south-west Victorian farming town, she wondered how the locals would greet her and her children. She need not have worried.

item.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
item.description: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

item.title: Thousands gather for UK anti-immigration rally and counter protests
item.description: The march was organised by far-right activist Tommy Robinson while a counter protest by anti-racism campaigners also took place as the country continues to be dogged by the issue of immigration.

item.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after gen Z protests prompt political change
item.description: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

item.title: Wallaroos primed for Rugby World Cup quarterfinal against Canada
item.description: Considered underdogs against the world number two, the Wallaroos are urged to be bold in their sudden-death encounter in Bristol.

item.title: US golfer John Daly takes a record 19 shots to play a par-5 on the PGA Tour Champions
item.description: John Daly is known as "Wild Thing" for his big-hitting, swashbuckling play, but the US golfer's round went right off the rails on the PGA Tour Champions, hitting the water seven times on a par-5.

item.title: Government assessor finds Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson breached code of conduct
item.description: The Office of the Independent Assessor found Mr Thompson breached conduct rules when circulating an email criticising another council worker's delays in responding to his request for legal funding.

item.title: Call for button battery redesign after new study reveals horrific injuries and fatalities
item.description: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

item.title: An Ozzy Osbourne tribute, a Mayhem Ball and a Mariah Carey medley delight fans at the 2025 MTV VMAs
item.description: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

item.title: Australians watched the moment of Charlie Kirk's assassination on social media with no warning
item.description: Young Australians say they are seeing graphic video of US commentator Charlie Kirk being shot dead pop up in their social media algorithms without warning.

item.title: Brisbane far too good for Gold Coast in QClash semifinal, setting up Collingwood prelim date
item.description: Brisbane's finals experience has come to the fore in a commanding and comfortable 53-point semifinal win over the Suns at the Gabba.

item.title: New Zealand fugitive Tom Phillips killed in shootout with police after four years on the run
item.description: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police during a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

item.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
item.description: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

item.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Birthday cards, bucket lists and (briefly) Banksy
item.description: See if you can work out who said it, and what they were talking about.

item.title: Inside the world of Jeffrey Epstein's friends, associates and alleged co-conspirators
item.description: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein intentionally sought out some of the world's most powerful people. Here's how they have responded to his disgraced reputation.

item.title: Nepal's gen Z protesters are continuing the fight for their future even after picking a new prime minister
item.description: A calm has fallen on Nepal's streets after days of violence and chaos. But leaders of the gen Z protest movement say the work's not done.

item.title: How the Jeffrey Epstein saga spread to British politics
item.description: After dogging the US president for months, evidence of a connection to Jeffrey Epstein has claimed a senior scalp within the British government.

item.title: What's next for the far-right political movement in Australia?
item.description: Australia's far-right movement has been buoyed by a wave of recent protests against mass immigration, with some saying the rallies were the "biggest thing that's happened in conservative and nationalist politics for a hundred years".

item.title: Nepal authorities lift curfew for Kathmandu and surrounding areas after gen Z protests
item.description: The curfew was lifted after Nepal swore in its first female prime minister, following deadly protests.

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: Penrith Panthers, Cronulla Sharks win NRL elimination finals against Warriors, Sydney Roosters
item.description: The Sharks end the Roosters' NRL season in the second NRL elimination final after Penrith took down the Warriors 24-8 in Auckland.

item.title: Toni Jordan spent her childhood at the greyhound track, inspiring her new novel Tenderfoot
item.description: The acclaimed author's father was a greyhound trainer and her mother ran a TAB. Her unconventional childhood inspired her eighth book, Tenderfoot.

item.title: Armani drama beyond the grave as will instructs heirs to sell or list on stock market
item.description: Giorgio Armani's will has surprised fashion watchers as it contains instructions to gradually sell off his company to a luxury brand or seek a listing on the stock market, in seeming contrast to his fiercely independent stance throughout his career.

item.title: Nourishing and easy sweet potato and lentil bowls - ABC News
item.description: This jazzy little bowl is made from simple ingredients. The sweet potato is roasted gently with spices and tinned lentils are roasted until crisp.

item.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

item.title: Rare good news for critically endangered east coast grey nurse sharks
item.description: Scientists say increasing numbers of east coast grey nurse sharks is rare good conservation news for the critically endangered species.

item.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories
item.description: We've got an ABC News homepage for you. Adjust your settings for the right mix of local and national news.

item.title: Torrie Lewis makes semifinals at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, Day 1
item.description: Torrie Lewis broke the national record to claim a spot in the women's 100m semifinal, as Lauren Ryan recorded Australia's best finish in a 10,000m final since 2003 on day one of the World Athletics Championships.

item.title: Who was Charlie Kirk, the MAGA podcaster and Trump ally shot dead in Utah?
item.description: Charlie Kirk rose from a teenage conservative campus activist to a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Regulator with oversight of gas leak 'scandal' had paid role with industry lobbyist
item.description: The man in charge of the Northern Territory government's handling of a major methane leak at a Santos gas plant was working with a lobbyist for the project's co-owner.

item.title: 'Clone' websites catch out Australian customers as online shopping scams become 'alarmingly' common
item.description: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

item.title: Right-wing activist and Trump ally Charlie Kirk shot dead at Utah university
item.description: Donald Trump confirms Charlie Kirk has been shot dead in front of a crowd of horrified students, with the US president describing the conservative activist as a "tremendous person" and a "very good friend".

item.title: Australia on alert to shot-hole borer threat as WA pivots to tree canopy rehabilitation
item.description: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot-hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

item.title: Homebuyers turn to shared ownership in expensive Wollongong market
item.description: Friends Gem and Renata have saved money buying a home together with their respective families in Wollongong, and say the pay-off goes much further.

item.title: Heavy police presence monitors thousands of protesters across Australia
item.description: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

item.title: When does Gout Gout run in the 200m at the 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, and other key events
item.description: The 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo sees Australia's largest-ever team tackle the best athletes on the planet. Here are the key events you won't want to miss.

item.title: NRLW wrap: Brisbane Broncos thrash the Cowboys 50-4, Gold Coast grab last finals spot
item.description: It's a big day for Queensland sides in the NRLW, as the Broncos — led by skipper Tamika Upton — are far too good for the third-placed Cowboys, while the Titans clinch the last finals spot with a win over Canberra.

item.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
item.description: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

item.title: A journey through 35 years of Canberra's history since the Raiders last won a minor premiership
item.description: Two weeks ago, the Canberra Raiders won the NRL's 2025 minor premiership by beating the Wests Tigers. It is their first minor premiership since 1990, and a lot has changed since then.

item.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

item.title: Construction workers are at higher risk of suicide. Here's how to look out for them
item.description: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

item.title: Supreme Court gives Queensland hospital permission to terminate 12yo girl's pregnancy
item.description: A 12-year-old girl in residential care in Queensland should be allowed to have an abortion, a court rules, after a judge found she was not capable of making the decision herself.

item.title: More than a dozen women complain about Brisbane doctor accused of performing 'sexually motivated' checks
item.description: Dr Stan Theodoros is facing disciplinary proceedings, lodged by Queensland's health ombudsman, in the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal (QCAT).

item.title: Artists and users boycotting Spotify over AI use and CEO's military tech
item.description: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
item.description: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

item.title: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor
item.description: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

item.title: Labor win Kiama by-election as voters replace disgraced MP Gareth Ward
item.description: The NSW Premier said Kiama now has the ear of the government after it claimed victory in the by-election triggered by the resignation of convicted rapist Gareth Ward.

item.title: Vanuatu warns Australia that expanding Woodside's North West Shelf gas project could breach international ruling
item.description: Australia's move to expand Woodside's North West Shelf gas project has not been welcomed in the Pacific, which is fighting the most dramatic effects of climate change.

item.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
item.description: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

item.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

item.title: Advocates call for action on brain health as AIHW reveals dementia is leading cause of death
item.description: Advocates warn the number of people with the condition could exceed 1 million without government intervention.
